thread.title: U.S. Senate Candidate Tammy Duckworth to Keynote New Trier Democrats Annual Dinner - Glencoe News
thread.title_full: U.S. Senate Candidate Tammy Duckworth to Keynote New Trier Democrats Annual Dinner - Glencoe News

author: Community Contributor Richard Brill
title: U.S. Senate Candidate Tammy Duckworth to Keynote New Trier Democrats Annual Dinner - Glencoe News
text:
WINNETKA, Ill., Sept. 25, 2015 - U.S. Representative, U.S. Senate candidate and war hero Tammy Duckworth will be keynote speaker at the New Trier Democrats Annual Dinner, Sunday, Oct. 11th at Maggiano's Restaurant in Old Orchard.
Tammy Duckworth was a National Guard helicopter pilot when her unit was sent to Iraq in 2003. When her Black Hawk helicopter was struck by a rocket, she lost both legs and the partial use of her right arm. Looking forward, she tapped her military experience and interests to become Director of the Illinois Department of Veterans Affairs, Assistant Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs and currently U.S. Rep. for Illinois's Eighth Congressional District where she serves on the House Armed Services Committee and House Oversight and Government Reforms Committees. She's now running for U.S. Senate in the 2016 Democratic Primary Election next March. Tammy Duckworth retired from the Illinois Army National Guard in October 2014 as a lieutenant colonel.
The New Trier Democrats Annual Dinner also welcomes U.S. Congresswoman Jan Schakowsky of the 9th District and expects former 10th District Congressman Brad Schneider, Illinois Attorney General Lisa Madigan, Sec. of State Jesse White, State Treasurer Mike Frerichs, Cook County Board President Toni Preckwinkle, Cook County Recorder of Deeds Karen Yarbrough, Highland Park Mayor Nancy Rotering and other elected officials. Cook County Commissioner Larry Suffredin will lead a discussion of Illinois and national issues with Tammy Duckworth.
The 2015 Annual Dinner includes a 5:00 p.m. reception and 6:15 p.m. dinner on Sunday, Oct. 11th at Maggiano's Little Italy Restaurant in Old Orchard. Information and tickets are available at www.ntdo.com .
New Trier Democrats have dedicated themselves since the 1960s to promoting government integrity and helping North Shore neighbors become involved in the political process. Strong grassroots volunteerism helps it thrive. The organization is based at 800 Oak Street, Winnetka, 847-446-8030, www.ntdo.org .
###
